docs.lead_paragraph: The second sign-up season under President Barack Obama's health care law is off to a good start but has a way to go to make it a success, administration officials said Tuesday.

headline.main: Officials Cite Progress on Health Care Enrollment
headline.print_headline: Officials Cite Progress on Health Care Enrollment

docs.snippet: The second sign-up season under President Barack Obama's health care law is off to a good start but has a way to go to make it a success, administration officials said Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: An administrative judge has upheld the dismissal of Sharon Helman, the Phoenix director, finding misconduct to support her ouster but saying the department did not prove that she was responsible for delays in care.

headline.main: Firing of V.A. Clinic Chief Is Upheld Over Gifts, Not Wait Lists
headline.print_headline: Firing of V.A. Clinic Chief Is Upheld Over Gifts, Not Wait Lists

docs.abstract: Federal administrative Judge Stephen C Mish upholds dismissal of Sharon Helman as director of Veterans Affairs health care system in Phoenix for misconduct including accepting gifts; says department did not prove that she manipulated waiting lists, resulting in delays for veteran care.
docs.snippet: An administrative judge has upheld the dismissal of Sharon Helman, the Phoenix director, finding misconduct to support her ouster but saying the department did not prove that she was responsible for delays in care.

docs.lead_paragraph: Representative Michael Grimm should resign from the House immediately after pleading guilty to tax fraud.
docs.abstract: Editorial calls on Republican leaders in the House, beginning with Speaker John Boehner, to urge Rep Michael Grimm to resign, in light of his pleading guilty to felony tax evasion; notes that while Grimm could technically keep his House seat, it is ethically wrong for him to do so.
docs.snippet: Representative Michael Grimm should resign from the House immediately after pleading guilty to tax fraud.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said new customers accounted for 30 percent of the total in what it sees as a promising start.

headline.main: So Far, 6.4 Million Obtain Health Care Coverage for 2015 in Federal Marketplace
headline.print_headline: So Far, 6.4 Million Obtain Health Care Coverage for 2015 in Federal Marketplace

docs.abstract: Obama administrations says 6.4 million people have obtained health insurance for 2015 through federal marketplace; new customers account for 30 percent of total, or 1.9 million.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration said new customers accounted for 30 percent of the total in what it sees as a promising start.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration has approved a Novo Nordisk diabetes drug as a treatment for obesity. It's the first injectable drug approved for weight loss.

headline.main: FDA Clears Novo Nordisk's Weight Loss Drug Saxenda
headline.print_headline: FDA Clears Novo Nordisk's Weight Loss Drug Saxenda

docs.snippet: The Food and Drug Administration has approved a Novo Nordisk diabetes drug as a treatment for obesity. It's the first injectable drug approved for weight loss.

docs.lead_paragraph: About 6.4 million Americans have selected a new individual healthcare plan or have been automatically signed up again for a 2015 insurance plan through the HealthCare.gov website, a top U.S. health official said on Tuesday, putting the agency nearer its 9.1 million goal.

headline.main: U.S. Says 6.4 Million Signed Up for 2015 HealthCare.gov Plans
headline.print_headline: U.S. Says 6.4 Million Signed Up for 2015 HealthCare.gov Plans

docs.lead_paragraph: Keurig Green Mountain Inc said on Tuesday it was recalling about 7.2 million single-serve brewing machines because they could overheat and spray hot liquids on users.

headline.print_headline: Keurig Recalls 7.2 Million Single-Serve Brewers, Stock Falls

docs.snippet: Keurig Green Mountain Inc said on Tuesday it was recalling about 7.2 million single-serve brewing machines because they could overheat and spray hot liquids on users.

headline.main: So Long, From You're the Boss

docs.abstract: After five years, this is the final post on You’re the Boss. As a parting gift, we offer some highlights from another year spent in the trenches, where we all continued to make mistakes and learn lessons.
docs.snippet: After five years, this is the final post on You’re the Boss. As a parting gift, we offer some highlights from another year spent in the trenches, where we all continued to make mistakes and learn lessons.

docs.lead_paragraph: The incoming majority leader acknowledges it will be challenging to change the mind-set of a caucus whose opposition to the president he was instrumental in leading.

headline.main: Mitch McConnell’s New Senate Goal: Turn Republican Dial to Yes
headline.print_headline: McConnell’s New Senate Goal: Turn Republican Dial to Yes

docs.abstract: Sen Mitch McConnell, incoming majority leader, says in interview that his main challenge will be to make chamber functional again and persuading Republicans accustomed to voting no to vote yes on legislation.
docs.snippet: The incoming majority leader acknowledges it will be challenging to change the mind-set of a caucus whose opposition to the president he was instrumental in leading.
